componenttext: Our next question comes from Sean McGowan of Needham.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: One question I had is regarding Monster High. So you mentioned the 22-minute episode coming up on Nickelodeon. Are there any plans for other TV support for that property?
componenttext: One question I had is regarding Monster High. So you mentioned the 22-minute episode coming up on Nickelodeon. Are there any plans for other TV support for that property?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: Yes. Sean, we are looking at it. The brand's off to a terrific start. Let me give you some of the online traffic numbers. The monsterhigh.com websites had over 7.5 million visitors. The music video was the most-watched video on YouTube for the weekend of
componenttext: Yes. Sean, we are looking at it. The brand's off to a terrific start. Let me give you some of the online traffic numbers. The monsterhigh.com websites had over 7.5 million visitors. The music video was the most-watched video on YouTube for the weekend of Friday, August 13. When we ran it, the Facebook Page has over 100,000 fans. This thing has not been broadly advertised. We're just starting to television advertise it now. The chapter book, as I mentioned, has done well. We're getting good reports from both Justice and Party City. So the brand certainly has some traction. We think investing behind the brand makes sense. We are going to do something with Nickelodeon, one of our strong network partners here for Halloween. And we are certainly looking at entertainment, both television and theatrical for Monster High as we build out the franchise.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: I know you mentioned the prospect of selling something theatrical well into future, but no definite plans or anything in the works for TV?
componenttext: I know you mentioned the prospect of selling something theatrical well into future, but no definite plans or anything in the works for TV?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: No definite plans. But again, I'd just tell you, it is something we're actively exploring.
componenttext: No definite plans. But again, I'd just tell you, it is something we're actively exploring.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: Could you remind us, Kevin, what was the other expense item, the $14 million last year?
componenttext: Could you remind us, Kevin, what was the other expense item, the $14 million last year?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: Yes, related to foreign exchange loss on our Venezuelan subsidiary, primarily.
componenttext: Yes, related to foreign exchange loss on our Venezuelan subsidiary, primarily.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: And I just want to circle back to the Fisher-Price core. It's one of the most suppressing things I thought in the quarter. Do think there's a demographic angle to this as well? I mean birth rates have been down, but do you think that -- is it that nature
componenttext: And I just want to circle back to the Fisher-Price core. It's one of the most suppressing things I thought in the quarter. Do think there's a demographic angle to this as well? I mean birth rates have been down, but do you think that -- is it that nature of the product, the infant/preschool product?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: No, I really don't, Sean. Certainly, the birth rate, which was favorable to us the last couple of years, has subsided with the recession. But again, looking at the NPD data, and we only have it for the first eight months, not for the most important four m
componenttext: No, I really don't, Sean. Certainly, the birth rate, which was favorable to us the last couple of years, has subsided with the recession. But again, looking at the NPD data, and we only have it for the first eight months, not for the most important four months of the year, but the infant/preschool category has held up well and Fisher-Price has as well.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from Tony Gikas of Piper Jaffray.
componenttext: Our next question comes from Tony Gikas of Piper Jaffray.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: Just as it relates to two properties, is Toy Story 3 product performing better than you expected? There wasn't a lot of mention in the press release. Similarly with WWE was kind of absent in your press release. Is that performing better than your expectat
componenttext: Just as it relates to two properties, is Toy Story 3 product performing better than you expected? There wasn't a lot of mention in the press release. Similarly with WWE was kind of absent in your press release. Is that performing better than your expectations? And lastly, any comment on MGA? It seems like there's a lot of noise around the litigation there and costs? Any kind of update you have that would be helpful?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: Well, I would say that all three of the major new properties for this year, that is Thomas, Toy Story, WWE, all three of those we've had high expectations for and we're at least achieving those expectations. As it relates to MGA, as you remember, the Nint
componenttext: Well, I would say that all three of the major new properties for this year, that is Thomas, Toy Story, WWE, all three of those we've had high expectations for and we're at least achieving those expectations. As it relates to MGA, as you remember, the Ninth Circuit decided that some of the aspects of the first phase of our case against MGA, in which we had a favorable outcome, will need to be retried. So the new judge, the judge from the first part of the case has retired from the bench and the new judge has combined what was sort of Phase 1 and Phase 2, Phase 1 being the intellectual property and Phase 2, primarily being trade secret theft, into one trial that starts, I believe, on January 11. We think that with the trial that has is comprehensive and puts everything together in one place, in front of one jury, we think that gives us an even more compelling case than was possible with a divided trial. And I have great confidence in the judicial system and the ability of the jury to right the wrongs that Mattel has suffered. So we're going to continue pursuing this for as long as we need to. It is expensive, but we have an obligation to the owners of the company, to the employees of the company to protect our intellectual property and our rights, and we're going to do so.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: This is the time of the year when all the retailers are talking about discounting of toys. Just for the record, does it appear to be anymore aggressive this year than it has in the past few years?
componenttext: This is the time of the year when all the retailers are talking about discounting of toys. Just for the record, does it appear to be anymore aggressive this year than it has in the past few years?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: No, it's still a little bit early. So it remains to be seen. There's clearly some market share shifts among retailers, but I wouldn't describe it at this point in time as being abnormal competition based on retail price.
componenttext: No, it's still a little bit early. So it remains to be seen. There's clearly some market share shifts among retailers, but I wouldn't describe it at this point in time as being abnormal competition based on retail price.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: With Toys "R" Us having a lot of these new pop-up stores, a lot more than last year, does that really grow overall toy sales in the industry? Or do you view that really as just redistribution of sales?
componenttext: With Toys "R" Us having a lot of these new pop-up stores, a lot more than last year, does that really grow overall toy sales in the industry? Or do you view that really as just redistribution of sales?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: I suspect it's going to be a little bit of both. I mean, providing more convenient access to products is good for the entire category, the toy category. Also, to me, Toys "R" Us must have concluded that they have an opportunity to gain some share by doing
componenttext: I suspect it's going to be a little bit of both. I mean, providing more convenient access to products is good for the entire category, the toy category. Also, to me, Toys "R" Us must have concluded that they have an opportunity to gain some share by doing so. So I suspect it's a combination of both things.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from Gerrick Johnson of BMO Capital Markets.
componenttext: Our next question comes from Gerrick Johnson of BMO Capital Markets.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: I was hoping you could talk a little bit about some things going on at Wal-Mart, perhaps the flexing of their space year-over-year looks down pretty significantly, thanks to project impact. I was wondering how that impacts your sales, as well as your inve
componenttext: I was hoping you could talk a little bit about some things going on at Wal-Mart, perhaps the flexing of their space year-over-year looks down pretty significantly, thanks to project impact. I was wondering how that impacts your sales, as well as your inventory position out there at retail? So what would say, inventory at retail be excluding Wal-Mart at discounters or retailers?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: Gerrick, I'm sensitive in not wanting to go down the slippery slope here of isolating customer information. I just respond by saying, broadly speaking, our retail inventories are down and it's not confined to one customer. That said, certainly, if you loo
componenttext: Gerrick, I'm sensitive in not wanting to go down the slippery slope here of isolating customer information. I just respond by saying, broadly speaking, our retail inventories are down and it's not confined to one customer. That said, certainly, if you look at starting last year, particularly infant and preschool section, Wal-Mart has added some house brands in that department and that's cut into our Fisher-Price business. At the same time, my expectation is Wal-Mart is going to be quite aggressive for this holiday season. We've seen what they did down in Mexico, where we have a significant Toy business and a significant Toy business with them. And I think they're going to flex their space this fourth quarter and be strong in the Toy business. But we'll have to see how it plays out.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: Where do you think you have too much inventory? You mentioned before where you have too little, where do you think you have to much inventory right now?
componenttext: Where do you think you have too much inventory? You mentioned before where you have too little, where do you think you have to much inventory right now?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: I don't think we have too much right now. But I'm sure that if you ask me that question in 90 days, I'll be able to answer it. But we're not at this point in time -- we're not sort of particularly long in one segment or in one brand.
componenttext: I don't think we have too much right now. But I'm sure that if you ask me that question in 90 days, I'll be able to answer it. But we're not at this point in time -- we're not sort of particularly long in one segment or in one brand.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: And switching back over to the legal department, can you give us some ballpark figures to how much you've spent cumulatively over the last five years or so on this legal expedition?
componenttext: And switching back over to the legal department, can you give us some ballpark figures to how much you've spent cumulatively over the last five years or so on this legal expedition?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: No, we haven't and we won't. And we just don't go into that kind of fine line detail. We have talked about the expense goes up in anticipation of trials or in years when there is a trial and the expense comes down following those. We're clearly in ramp-up
componenttext: No, we haven't and we won't. And we just don't go into that kind of fine line detail. We have talked about the expense goes up in anticipation of trials or in years when there is a trial and the expense comes down following those. We're clearly in ramp-up mode right now. It is Phase 1 and Phase 2 of the trial together, that starts January 11. We've been working very hard this entire year. We'll continue working very hard up until the trial. So we're clearly in ramp-up mode on the expense. The trial starts January 11, and we'll have to see what happens following that.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: So if you're spending a lot in ramp-up mode, should we assume that in 2011, the incremental legal expense, that question will ask every single quarter will be incremental expense be up or down in 2011?
componenttext: So if you're spending a lot in ramp-up mode, should we assume that in 2011, the incremental legal expense, that question will ask every single quarter will be incremental expense be up or down in 2011?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: We're not going to give guidance on anything, but specifically as it relates to legal expense. We're going to have to see how the case plays out. We'll have to see how long that case lasts and what we need to do during the case and what happens after the
componenttext: We're not going to give guidance on anything, but specifically as it relates to legal expense. We're going to have to see how the case plays out. We'll have to see how long that case lasts and what we need to do during the case and what happens after the case. So I don't even know if I can predict it right now. All I can tell you is, weÕll continue making the investment to protect our intellectual property, to right the wrongs that happened.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: And finally on that topic, there've been new charges that MGA has brought out, corporate espionage, stuff like that. Will that be part of the overall January 11 trial? Or is that something separate?
componenttext: And finally on that topic, there've been new charges that MGA has brought out, corporate espionage, stuff like that. Will that be part of the overall January 11 trial? Or is that something separate?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: As we've said about this, we believe that MGA's 11th hour counterclaims, if you will, are a cynical attempt to deflect the tension from their own wrongdoing. So the answer we filed in response to those counterclaims, which I think was filed very recently,
componenttext: As we've said about this, we believe that MGA's 11th hour counterclaims, if you will, are a cynical attempt to deflect the tension from their own wrongdoing. So the answer we filed in response to those counterclaims, which I think was filed very recently, speaks for itself. I'm not going to get into the specifics of the case, other than to say that, we're ready to go in front of a jury.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: But is that a separate issue? Is it a separate trial? Or are those all going to be combined into the one January 11 trial?
componenttext: But is that a separate issue? Is it a separate trial? Or are those all going to be combined into the one January 11 trial?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: Well, I don't know exactly what's going to be in and out of the trial, but I do believe that there will not be a separate trial on those claims.
componenttext: Well, I don't know exactly what's going to be in and out of the trial, but I do believe that there will not be a separate trial on those claims.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: And are there any pre-trial motions, or anything that we should be concerned about between now and January 11?
componenttext: And are there any pre-trial motions, or anything that we should be concerned about between now and January 11?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: There are. There are, in this case, an incredible number of motions being filed. I think the key thing between here and there are motions for summary judgment on some of the claims to really define what will go in front of the jury.
componenttext: There are. There are, in this case, an incredible number of motions being filed. I think the key thing between here and there are motions for summary judgment on some of the claims to really define what will go in front of the jury.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from Linda Bolton Weiser of Caris.
componenttext: Our next question comes from Linda Bolton Weiser of Caris.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: So I actually, like, was down in Arkansas at the Wal-Mart Analyst Meeting a few days ago, and they definitely talked about taking a cue from what they did in Mexico and flexing the space and creating additional space. And I thought they said, in December,
componenttext: So I actually, like, was down in Arkansas at the Wal-Mart Analyst Meeting a few days ago, and they definitely talked about taking a cue from what they did in Mexico and flexing the space and creating additional space. And I thought they said, in December, and it would be like a doubling of space. And I know you don't want to get too detailed, but did I misunderstand them? And also, on the inventory issue, they are actually reversing a lot of the inventory reductions they had made over the last few years as part of almost a reversal of strategy. So are you saying that you don't expect or the toys is not getting that bump up in inventory build at retail, and then it's going more to other categories? Or can you just kind of elaborate on that a little bit?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: No, Linda, you're talking directly to them. So I don't want to get in between you and one of our customers. I'd just say that I think they're gearing up and they have plans, they have a good holiday season as do several other major retailers. And my sense
componenttext: No, Linda, you're talking directly to them. So I don't want to get in between you and one of our customers. I'd just say that I think they're gearing up and they have plans, they have a good holiday season as do several other major retailers. And my sense is by the time Christmas comes, their stores are going to have a good selection of toys, and I'm hopeful we have our fair share of that selection.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: And then just on the Fisher-Price again, given like the price points on the mix of price points is certainly different as you've talked about several times, is there any way you can describe what the price/mix versus the unit volume growth for Fisher-Pric
componenttext: And then just on the Fisher-Price again, given like the price points on the mix of price points is certainly different as you've talked about several times, is there any way you can describe what the price/mix versus the unit volume growth for Fisher-Price was in the quarter to help us better understand that?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: No, other than to just qualitatively say, I don't think there's a big impact on price/mix. It's certainly a component when you look at some of these key drivers. But right now, I would tell you that it tends to be more in the area of what selling in the r
componenttext: No, other than to just qualitatively say, I don't think there's a big impact on price/mix. It's certainly a component when you look at some of these key drivers. But right now, I would tell you that it tends to be more in the area of what selling in the retailers. And as I've mentioned now since really last holiday season, the POS and the Core business has been a little soft. So we have adjusted the price/mix, but I think that'll play out more as the holiday season approaches.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: And then, I think you mentioned in the SG&A that there was $8 million pretax impairment charge for the house of Barbie. Is that the store in Shanghai? And can you just describe why did you need to take that impairment charge? Is that store not doing what
componenttext: And then, I think you mentioned in the SG&A that there was $8 million pretax impairment charge for the house of Barbie. Is that the store in Shanghai? And can you just describe why did you need to take that impairment charge? Is that store not doing what you wanted it to do? And can you just -- is there going to be more charges related to it?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: No, there won't be more charges. But the Barbie Shanghai store was opened as part of a marketing strategy that was specific to China that introduced the total brand, if you will, to Chinese girls and moms, most of whom who are not familiar with the brand.
componenttext: No, there won't be more charges. But the Barbie Shanghai store was opened as part of a marketing strategy that was specific to China that introduced the total brand, if you will, to Chinese girls and moms, most of whom who are not familiar with the brand. And the toy sales have actually been pretty good in that store. But the overall retail sales have not performed to our expectations. So based on the financial performance of the store, we were required the write-off substantially all of our leasehold improvements.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: So then for the time being, you think that's enough of a write-off for now or. . .
componenttext: So then for the time being, you think that's enough of a write-off for now or. . .

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: I think it's enough of a write-off for now, and I can't imagine there's anything or much left to write-off in the future.
componenttext: I think it's enough of a write-off for now, and I can't imagine there's anything or much left to write-off in the future.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: That's right, Bob.
componenttext: That's right, Bob.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: Our last question comes from Ed Woo of Wedbush Securities.
componenttext: Our last question comes from Ed Woo of Wedbush Securities.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: How easy is it for you to be of the chase products displayed into the holiday season?
componenttext: How easy is it for you to be of the chase products displayed into the holiday season?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: It's going to be hard, Ed, and that's one of the issues here is, as retailers think the holidays are going to be late is they take product later. When something's running, there's going to be less opportunity to chase it. So we're chasing some goods as we
componenttext: It's going to be hard, Ed, and that's one of the issues here is, as retailers think the holidays are going to be late is they take product later. When something's running, there's going to be less opportunity to chase it. So we're chasing some goods as we speak, even though our inventories are in pretty good shape. We don't have enough of some of the toys. And the later the season is, the harder it is to chase.

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: Also, on recall expenses, was there any recall expense for the recent announcement? And do you expect any in the fourth quarter?
componenttext: Also, on recall expenses, was there any recall expense for the recent announcement? And do you expect any in the fourth quarter?

headline: Mattel Inc., Q3 2010 Earnings Call, Oct 15, 2010
componenttextpreview: As you know, we recalled in September 2010, in cooperation with the Consumer Product Safety Commission, certain Fisher-Price products. As a result, we recorded $7.6 million accrual, which relates to our estimates of customer sales returns. Our obligation
componenttext: As you know, we recalled in September 2010, in cooperation with the Consumer Product Safety Commission, certain Fisher-Price products. As a result, we recorded $7.6 million accrual, which relates to our estimates of customer sales returns. Our obligation to consumers and other related costs. We think the accrual is appropriate and at this point, we don't expect any additional charge in the fourth quarter. But this is one of those accruals at each quarter you true it up to your experience rate on recalls.

componenttext: Thanks, everyone.
